ygData.subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Content-Type parameters
ygData.msgSnippet: As far as the HTTP is concerned, yes, arbitrary params are allowed. But their semantics are up to media type specifications (for the sake of interop). Subbu

As far as the HTTP is concerned, yes, arbitrary params are allowed. But the=
ir semantics are up to media type specifications (for the sake of interop).=


Subbu

On Jun 18, 2010, at 7:02 AM, Tim Williams wrote:

> Are arbitrary =
parameters allowed for all Media Types?  Are the
> allowable one's defined =
in the Media Type documentation itself or
> where?  For some context, Jerse=
y's mechanism for allowing the server
> to have a preferred media type is t=
o use a "quality of source" or "qs"
> parameter in its Produces annotation[=
1].  Something like:
> 
> @Produces("application/xml;qs=3D2")
> public Obje=
ct getAsXml()
> 
> In the response, the "qs" then parameter comes along in =
the
> ContentType header.  I think, as Paul suggested in that mail, clients=

> will ignore it, but it got me curious about the more general case.
> Doe=
s section 3.7[2] mean that arbitrary parameters are allowed?
> 
> Thanks,
>=
 --tim
> 
> [1] - https://jersey.dev.java.net/servlets/BrowseList?list=3Dus=
ers&by=3Dthread&from=3D2968827
> [2] - http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/=
rfc2616-sec3.html#sec3.7
>
